item.description:
Girls Rock!, a documentary by Arne Johnson and Shane King (2007, 90 min), explores a Rock n Roll Camp where girls from all over the country come to learn Rock-- forming bands, writing songs, and building community. Laura, an adopted Korean girl, is obsessed with death metal; Misty is emerging from a life of meth-addiction, homelessness, and gang activity; Palace is a sweet-seeming 8 year old with a heavy metal sneer; and Aurelia is writing a fourteen-song cycle about her dog, Poppi. During one week the girls form bands, write songs, and play a gig, while the rest of the camp engages in an experiment in empowerment that leaves no one unchanged. As the final performance draws near, the girls are thrown into a paroxysm of excitement and self-discovery, achieving things they never thought possible. The film uses video diaries, verete footage, interviews and animations. Seattle Magazine describes Girls Rock as "revolutionary, heartbreaking, and laugh-out-loud funny. Absolutely not to be missed."
After the film we'll be going to a local restaurant for our group discussion.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll hold up a Meetup sign in the front of the theater at the end of the film.
